sentences.en: A leisurely process of decision - making creates a presumption in favor of eventual inaction.
sentences.cn: 不慌不忙地作决定就会使人猜测是打算不了了之.

sentences.en: Already we are beginning to roll in eventual wealth.
sentences.cn: 咱们已经开始往富人队里混了.

sentences.en: Both parties expressed optimism about an eventual solution.
sentences.cn: 双方对问题的最终解决都表示乐观.

sentences.en: Both sides were happy with the eventual outcome of the talks.
sentences.cn: 双方对会谈的最终结果都感到满意。

sentences.en: His efforts were repaid by the eventual success.
sentences.cn: 他的努力得到的报偿是最后的成功.

sentences.en: I went home before the end of the meeting. What was the eventual decision?
sentences.cn: 会议没结束我就回家了. 最后怎么决定的?

sentences.en: It was difficult to see what the thinking was behind their eventual decision.
sentences.cn: 很难看出他们的最终决定背后有什么想法.

sentences.en: Nim had forgotten the eventual outcome.
sentences.cn: 尼姆已经忘了最后的结果怎样.

sentences.en: Only a few days before he had predicted an eventual smash to Addison.
sentences.cn: 就在前几天,他曾向爱迪生预言过可能发生的倒闭.
几所学校面临最终关闭.

sentences.en: Sweden were the eventual winners of the tournament.
sentences.cn: 瑞典队是锦标赛的最后赢家。

sentences.en: the eventual winner of the tournament
The sketch should be a kind of rehearsal for the eventual painting.
sentences.cn: 草图应该是最终绘画的某种演练。

sentences.en: the state's eventual separation from the federation
sentences.cn: 那个州最终与联邦的脱离

sentences.en: There are many who believe that civil war will be the eventual outcome of the racial tension in the country.
sentences.cn: 有很多人相信，该国种族关系的紧张最终将导致内战。

sentences.en: Unquestionably his missionary work between 1940 and 1942 had much to do with eventual success.
sentences.cn: 毫无问题是,他在一九四○年至一九四二年间的传道式工作与那次决定性的成功有很大关系.

words.tran_cn: 可能性；可能发生的事；不测的事
最后的，结果的；可能的；终于的

trans.tran_en: happening at the end of a long period of time or after a lot of other things have happened
